title: YGGDRASIL: KodamaSounds 5th Anniversary Album
price: Event Price: 3500 yen | Digital Price: 20â‚¬ / 3500 yen | Shop Price: 3500 yen + tax

description.en: The roots of the YGGDRASIL take shape and form, to create an ascension towards a new future. "YGGDRASIL" is KodamaSounds' 5th massive anniversary project, with the goal of celebrating the legacy and future of the circle. You will see familiar faces, maybe even some new ones. We just hope the sprout of this tree will grow larger and prettier as time goes on, and that you will be able to reminisce and discover new grounds. We hope you can feel the creativity of this tree carrying your feelings for you alongside ours.

title.en: My Composition Method ~ Dedicated to DTMers

description: â€¢ Composer, Arranger & Lyrics: Shogo Sakai [é…’äº•çœå¾]
â€¢ Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Shogo Sakai [é…’äº•çœå¾]

â€¢ About this track: I think of people congregating around KodamaSounds as people giving their all for music composition. I was having trouble deciding what to do to celebrate this 5th anniversary, a date to be remembered for. I ultimately decided to make this track with weird and funny lyrics: â€œMy Composition Method ~ Dedicated to DTMersâ€. [KodamaSoundsæ§˜ã®å…ƒã«é›†ã†äººãŸã¡ã¯ã€ä½œæ›²ã‚’æ‰‹ãŒã‘ã‚‹äººãŸã¡ã®é›†å›£ã ã¨æƒ³åƒã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ãã®ä¸­ã§ã€ï¼•å‘¨å¹´ã¨ã„ã†è¨˜å¿µã™ã¹ãå‘¨å¹´ã«ã€ã©ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªæ›²ãŒè‰¯ã„ã‹ï¼Ÿã¨æ‚©ã¿ã€ã“ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªä¸€é¢¨å¤‰ã‚ã£ãŸæ­Œè©ã®æ›²ã‚’æ›¸ãä¸‹ã‚ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ã€Œç§ã®ä½œæ›²æ–¹æ³•ã€œDTMerã«æ§ãã€œã€ã§ã™ã€‚]

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: Iâ€™m really honored to have been invited to participate in this project to celebrate KodamaSoundsâ€™ 5th anniversary. [ã“ã®åº¦ã¯ã€å¾¡ãƒãƒ¼ãƒ ã®æ´»å‹•ï¼•å‘¨å¹´ã‚’è¿ãˆã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹ã«å½“ãŸã£ã¦ã€ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ”ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã«å‚åŠ ã§ãã‚‹ã“ã¨ã‚’å…‰æ „ã«å­˜ã˜ã¾ã™ã€‚]
What goes on in my mind
When I write a song? Let me tell you.
The very first thing I do is write the melody.
I write it down with a staff paper in front of me.
If I play the piano, my fingers fall into old habits,
If I get stuck in a rut,
I feel like, "Oh, my life is over,"
A feeling of hitting rock bottom.
Ah, you may laugh, but songwriting
Once the melody is written, I move on to arranging.
I program the drums to fit the song's length.
When the rhythm section is solid, I'm happy!
What sound should I choose for the main melody?
The face of the song, it's the most important part.
I spend a whole day on just one sound,
"Why am I stuck in a rut here?" Wow
Making a living through music is a happy thing.
I know that, but songwriting is difficult.

02.title: A Gust of Wind
description: â€¢ Composer & Arranger: Arman Aspromonti (Resonant Union)
â€¢ Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by Arman Aspromonti (Resonant Union)
â€¢ Used VSTs & Samples: KORG SGX-2, Spitfire Chamber Strings, Aaron Venture Woodwinds, Roland SRX World, Roland SRX Orchestra, KORG Triton, Plogue Chipsounds, Acoustic Bass Premier G

â€¢ About this track: You feel the wind of inspiration lifting you, carrying you gently as you run forward across the green landscape. For a fleeting moment, everything is alright. Right now, you can fly.

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: KodamaSounds means a lot to me, and I have truly enjoyed seeing it grow over the past five years. As a founder and manager of Resonant Union, I can truly relate to the struggles and challenges, as well as the victories and joys of organising a group like this. I feel it's truly a privilege to get to be part of a community like this. Thank you for having me. Here's to five more excellent years!

03.title: The Rhodadendron
description: â€¢ Composer, Arranger, Accordion & Tin Whistle: Justin Thornburgh
â€¢ Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Justin Thornburgh
â€¢ Used VSTs & Samples: Spitfire Chamber Strings, Spitfire Studio Brass, Crow Hill Vaults Solo Bodhran, EW Hollywood Orchestral Percussion

â€¢ About this track: This composition contains two jigs that I wrote which I call The Leaf (in G) and The Cardboard Box (in Am). The overall structure is inspired by Irish session tune sets in which tunes are strung together back to back. In this case, there is some introductory material that leads into the first tune, The Leaf, which flows directly into The Cardboard Box, and then transitions into the ending material via the ever sweet Am to A major key change.

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: KodamaSounds projects are always really nicely themed and there's nice variety in projects. The artists that come together to participate on these projects are great, so it's fun to be a part of it.

04.title: Ecru
description: â€¢ Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Zohka
â€¢ Used Software: Logic Pro X

â€¢ About this track: I tried to do something different from my usual style to compose this experimental track. It is a song about a little boat. [ã“ã‚Œã¾ã§ã®ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ•ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã‹ã‚‰é›¢ã‚Œã¦ã€å½¢å¼ã‚’æ•´ãˆãšã«åˆ¶ä½œã—ãŸå®Ÿé¨“ä½œã€‚å°èˆŸã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã®æ›²ã€‚]

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: Until today, Iâ€™ve only contributed to a single KodamaSounds project. I really like the song I made for that project, but it sounded like what you can usually expect of me. Thinking back on it, I think it lacked something fresh. The restrictions being this lax for this new projectmade it an interesting challenge, and I was able to go beyond my limits to make something new. [KodamaSoundsã«ã¯ã“ã‚Œã¾ã§ã«ä¸€åº¦ã ã‘å‚åŠ ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ãã®ã¨ãã«æŠ•ç¨¿ã—ãŸä½œå“ã¯æ°—ã«å…¥ã£ã¦ã¯ã„ã¾ã™ãŒã€è‡ªåˆ†ã®ä½œé¢¨ã‚‰ã—ã„ä½œå“ã§ã€è‡ªåˆ†ã«ã¨ã£ã¦ã¯ã»ã¨ã‚“ã©æ–°è¦æ€§ãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã§ã—ãŸã€‚ä»Šå›ã®ä¼ç”»ã§ã¯ä½œé¢¨ã®åˆ¶ç´„ãŒã»ã¼ãªã„ã®ã§ã€ã§ãã‚‹é™ã‚Šã®æŒ‘æˆ¦ãŒã§ãã¾ã—ãŸã€‚]

05.title: Entanglement
description: Please check the track's individual link on Bandcamp for detailed credits.
â€¢ Composer & Arranger: Michael Stokol (Resonant Union)
â€¢ Produced & Mixed by Michael Stokol (Resonant Union)
â€¢ Used Software: MuseScore, Logic Pro

â€¢ About this track: I wrote this piece back in 2023 during my music studies at The University of Melbourne. The music specialisations on offer at my university included Classical Performance, Jazz & Improvisation (J&I), Classical Composition, Interactive Composition (IC) and Musicology/Ethnomusicology. IC and J&I were originally courses offered by the former Victorian College of the Arts (VCA) curriculim, which has now been merged with the Melbourne Conservatorium of Music (MCM) at The University of Melbourne. Despite all these courses moving onto the same campus in 2019, students in the formerly VCA-based courses didn't often get the chance to interact with those studying under traditionally MCM-based courses, and vice versa. To oppose this arbitrary separation, I spent time making friends with students from the formerly VCA-based courses, and brought them together to create this piece. I invited two friends from IC, two friends from J&I and one friend from classical performance to play a piece that I, a classical composition student, composed for all of them. This piece represents this entanglement of disciplines that really arenâ€™t all that different from each other, and the collaboration of all of our creative voices; drawing from art music, jazz and other experimental influences.

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: I came to be involved with KodamaSounds via my activities with Resonant Union, as our contributing artists often participated on both groups' projects. I actually feel a bit bad since most of my conributions to KodamaSounds have been past works that I haven't found the opportunity to release independently ("leftovers" so to speak), and my submission for YGGDRASIL won't be any different, haha. That said, I'm truly grateful that Robin has been willing to accept and release these past compositions of mine on KodamaSounds' albums, and it's an honour to be part of such a large and growing group.
Key: C Minor (except for the final chord)

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: It's been fun to write some songs for KodamaSounds ğŸ‘
Arbor vitaeni tas, In mortevi tare nasctur
Arbor vitaea terni tasa, In mortevi tare nasceca

07.title: AL[ONE] - White Flower
description: â€¢ Composer & Arranger: Philip Saguil (Resonant Union)
â€¢ Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Philip Saguil (Resonant Union)
â€¢ Used VSTs & Samples: Sonuscore Lo-Ki Piano, Addictive Keys

â€¢ About this track: AL[ONE] - White Flower was the title screen music to a game project I worked on college. It was a 2D platformer about a struggle between humanity and the evolving field of androids set in a dying world. Nothing ever came of it, but I owe learning sound design to that experience. I have fond memories of improvising on my midi keyboard while working, which was the foundation for this piece. Fivda reached out to me asking if had any old tracks I'd like to use for this project, and together we decided this piece could be expanded into the state it is now. I hope you enjoy!

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: I've had the pleasure of contributing to one Kodama album every year since 2022. I enjoy the original composition projects the circle releases under ECLECTIC RESONANCE, and I hope to contribute to more in the future! Building up Resonant Union next to KodamaSounds, I've always viewed this group as a sister to our own. I am very happy to see them reach larger audiences as the years continue on, and can't wait to see what they become in the future.

08.title: Per Past Pledges
description: â€¢ Composer, Arranger, Electric Guitar & Acoustic Guitar: YOKAI (KodamaSounds)
â€¢ Vocal Mixing & Mastering Engineer: KAYA
â€¢ Used VSTs & Samples: Pianoteq 8, HALion sonic, Groove Agent SE 01, Ezbass

YOKAI: Itâ€™s the first time Iâ€™ve worked on a track with so many people, and it was a challenge both in terms of coordination and communication. I learned a lot from this project, and Iâ€™m very happy with the result because everyone gave their best. We supported each other even during the difficult moments, and I take away from this that, in the end, everyone genuinely wanted to create something good.

eili: Its always fun to contribute to fantasy-esque music. The unique blend of Fantasy and other modern elements, like JPop, and Rock, makes the song feel like a fresh take on a beloved genre. Having live instruments always brings more punch and a personal touch to songs. I personally love singing songs whose lyrics blend more than one language, coined or otherwise.

v1ris: It was such a joy to record violin for this song! YOKAI wrote such a beautiful, full-sounding string part for me to play. I always enjoy projects that call for the layering of several violin recordings to create a full section sound, and I think it turned out beautifully in the final production.
Volumetrique: Thanks for the opportunity to work on the instrumental mix! Happy to work with YOKAI again!!
â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project:

YOKAI: I arrived at Kodama two years ago now, but it feels like so much longer! This year has been the most important one for me, with the release of my third album under the circle. This album was even pressed and distributed in Japan! Itâ€™s a dream Iâ€™ve had for a long time, one I thought was unattainable until now but the stars aligned with the live presentation of the album for M3. One aspect I particularly appreciate about Kodama is the natural kindness of its members, a strong sense of mutual support and community that encourages you to push yourself further. Even though we compose on our own, there are always plenty of members available. Personally, I find this amazing because I love creating alone but surrounding myself with others when itâ€™s needed. A big thank you to Kodama for everything it brings me, both creatively and personally, in my own individual growth!
eili: I was really honored to be invited to such a special achievement. Anytime an indie studio sees success, it makes me just a little bit happier. I was glad to be a part of it.

v1ris: The online VGM community has changed my life, and KodamaSounds is absolutely an instrumental part of that since I've started getting involved with it over the past year! There are so many wonderful people I've met through it, and it's always an honor and a privilege to have contributed to its projects, whether I'm arranging/composing, or playing violin (which you can hear me play on YGGDRASIL!)
the lost present still echoes on
stars I only saw in a dream
â€œrootsâ€ spread out towards that sky
a music score wandering through time
the entrusted mystery whispers in your ears
the maze opens up, bridging us together
â€œrootsâ€ spread out, and then, connect
for all hearts, for all creatures
despite your accumulated rust and rot
and your words that have already turned red
hopes [spores] keep on disseminating towards the light
â€œrootsâ€ still spread out and resonate
â€œrootsâ€ spread out, and then, sing
from the â€œrootsâ€, a certain bloodline want to sprout
from the â€œrootsâ€, weâ€™re seeking our past
from the â€œrootsâ€, warm memories embrace me
â€œrootâ€ spread out into Yggdrasil again

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: I haven't provided much songs or remixes, but it was a fun experience to try out different things
